page.title: 18Mr Ben Jones continued
page.content: How different the valley in the strike of 1984. So many of the pits are closed that there was little visible effect of any hardship. Schools provided free meals for miners children during the week, on saturday and during the holidays.Womens groups made up food parcels and mine leaders organised fetes to raise strike funds. There was still much evidence of unity, goodwill and community spirit but we all know that the valley has changed for all time from its heyday in the mining area. Education is not treasured as before but if the region continues to develop its potential as a residential area and if opportunities become more limited to qualified personnel, then perhaps its value will be restored.
